intro: Desmotrichum interjectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white ray florets and yellow disk florets. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Desmotrichum interjectum is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, where it thrives in full sun.
